{{Expand Arabic|date=March 2011}} {{Infobox musical artist |name = Sayed Darwish |image = Sayed Darwish.JPG |caption = |image_size = |background = solo_singer |birth_name = |alias = |birth_date = {{Birth date|1892|3|17|df=y}} |origin = [[Alexandria]], [[Egypt]] | Nationality = Egyptian | death_date = {{Death date and age|1923|9|15|1892|3|17|df=y}} | death_place = [[Egypt]] |instrument = [[Vocals]], [[Oud]] |genre = Egyptian music |occupation = [[Singer]], [[Songwriter]], [[Record Producer]], [[Musician]] |years_active = |label = |associated_acts = |website = |current_members = |past_members = }} '''Sayed Darwish''' ({{lang-ar|Ø³ÙØ¯ Ø¯Ø±ÙÙØ´}}, {{IPA-arz|ËsÃ¦jjed dÃ¦É¾ËwiËÊ|IPA}}; March 17, 1892 â September 15, 1923) was an [[Egyptians|Egyptian]] singer and composer who was considered the father of [[Music of Egypt|Egyptian]] popular music and one of their greatest musicians and their single greatest composer. He was born in [[Alexandria]] on March 17, 1892. Darwish died of a [[heart attack]] in Alexandria on September 15, 1923 (aged 31). The cause of his death is still unknown. Some say he was poisoned, others say he died from a cocaine overdose.{{cite book |title=Biographical Dictionary of Modern Egypt |last=Goldschmidt |first=Arthur |year=2000 |publisher=[[Lynne Rienner Publishers]] |location=Egypt |isbn=1555872298 |pages=47 }} ==Compositions== ===Egyptian national anthem=== {{Main|Bilady, Bilady, Bilady}} {{Infobox Anthem | title = {{lang-ar|Ø¨ÙØ§Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ø¯Ù}} | transcription = Bilady, Bilady, Bilady | english_title = My country, my country, my country | prefix = National | country = {{EGY}} | author = [[Mohamed Younis Al-Qady]] | lyrics_date = 1878 | composer = Sayed Darwish | music_date = 1923 | adopted = 1923
1952 (unofficially)
1979 (officially) | sound = Bilady, Bilady, Bilady.ogg | sound_title = Bilady, Bilady, Bilady (Instrumental) }} Sayed Darwish put music to the Egyptian national anthem, ''[[Bilady, Bilady, Bilady]]'', the words of which were adapted from a famous speech by [[Mustafa Kamil Pasha|Mustafa Kamil]]. Coincidentally, on the day of his death, the national Egyptian leader [[Saad Zaghloul]] returned from exile; the Egyptians sang Darwish's new song "[[Bilady, Bilady, Bilady]]" which was to become the national anthem in 1979. ===Other compositions=== Sayed Darwish has many well known songs. A selective number of compositions include: *"El Hilwadi" -the beautiful one *"Zouruni" - visit me *"Shed el hezam" - Pull the belt *"Malo'ouna" - doomed *"Ana Haweit" - I fell in love *"Oum Ya Masry" - Rise you Egyptian *"[[Salma Ya Salama]] {{clear}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Darwish | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = March 17, 1892 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = September 15, 1923 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Egypt]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Darwish}} [[Category:1892 births]] [[Category:1923 deaths]] [[Category:Egyptian composers]] [[Category:Egyptian singers]] [[Category:National anthem writers]] [[Category:People from Alexandria]] {{Africa-musician-stub}} {{Africa-singer-stub}} {{composer-stub}} {{Egypt-bio-stub}} [[ar:Ø³ÙØ¯ Ø¯Ø±ÙÙØ´]] [[es:Sayed Darwich]] [[fr:Sayed Darwich]] [[it:Sayed Darwish]] [[he:×¡××× ××¨××××©]] [[arz:Ø³ÙØ¯ Ø¯Ø±ÙÙØ´]] [[ja:ãµã¤ã¼ãã»ãã«ã¦ã£ã¼ã·ã¥]] [[pt:Sayed Darwish]] [[uk:Ð¡Ð°Ð¹ÑÐ´ ÐÐ°ÑÐ²ÑÑ]]
